description: The study of leadership requires a broad understanding of the many critical contemporary issues
emerging in todayÂ’s environment. This course is designed to provide students with a comprehensive
understanding of leadership principles, theories, and practices. The course explores various
aspects of leadership, from personal development to organizational dynamics, preparing students to
become effective leaders in diverse settings. This course combines insights from business
strategy, political science, cognitive psychology, and environmental studies. Not open to first
year students. Prerequisite: sophomore standing or above
